channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: European troops arrive in Greenland to boost the Arctic island's security
item.description: Troops from several European countries, including France, Germany, Norway and Sweden, are arriving in Greenland after talks between Denmark, Greenland...

item.title: This country taxes menstrual pads as luxury goods. She's suing to end the tax
item.description: Bushra Mahnoor remembers the shame she felt when she had her period as a teen and did not have the supplies she needed. Today she leads a campaign to ...

item.title: Julian Barnes says he's enjoying himself, but that 'Departure(s)' is his last book
item.description: Part memoir and part fiction, Barnes' hybrid novel publishes the day after his 80th birthday. He's been living with a rare form of blood cancer for si...

item.title: FBI searches WaPo reporter's home. And, Trump restores $2B to public health funds
item.description: The FBI searches the home of a Washington Post reporter as part of a leak investigation. And, the Trump administration restores $2B for mental health ...

item.title: 24 hours of chaos as mental health grants are slashed then restored
item.description: For 24 hours, it was unclear which mental health and addiction programs would survive and who would still have jobs when the dust settled.

item.title: María Machado visiting Trump after offering to share Nobel with him
item.description: Venezuelan opposition leader María Machado has said she wants to give her Nobel Prize to Trump and "share it with him," for removing Nicolás Maduro fr...

item.title: How much will a debt collector take you to court over?
item.description: Understanding debt collection thresholds can help you navigate your options and avoid legal consequences.

item.title: Federal agent shoots Minneapolis man in leg after shovel attack, officials say
item.description: The incident comes as President Donald Trump threatens to use the Insurrection Act on protesters.

item.title: Boeing knew of flaw in part linked to UPS plane crash, US safety board report says
item.description: An aircraft that crashed in November had a structural flaw that had been identified by Boeing 15 years ago, investigators say.

item.title: 1/13: CBS Evening News
item.description: Dokoupil interviews President Trump on Iran crackdown, Fed Chair Powell and more; Tony Dokoupil's final thoughts from Detroit

item.title: Widespread delays hit Uganda election amid internet shutdown
item.description: The election is a rematch between Bobi Wine and Yoweri Museveni, who has been president for 40 years.

item.title: European military personnel arrive in Greenland as Trump says US needs island
item.description: France says a 15-strong French military contingent has arrived and more forces will be there in the coming days.

item.title: What are today's mortgage interest rates: January 15, 2026?
item.description: Looking to buy a home or refinance your current one? These are the mortgage interest rates you need to know first.

item.title: 20 charged in connection with rigging college basketball games
item.description: Federal prosecutors charged 20 people in an alleged point-shaving scheme involving dozens of college basketball players, according to an indictment.

item.title: Iran judiciary denies plan to execute detained protester Erfan Soltani
item.description: The judiciary says Soltani is not facing charges carrying the death penalty, while a rights group reports that the execution has been "postponed".

item.title: Democrats propose state laws to limit ICE after Minneapolis shooting of Renee Good
Fear and anger spread after another immigration shooting in Minneapolis
item.description: A federal officer has shot a man in the leg in Minneapolis after being attacked with a shovel and broom handle.

item.title: Liberian man arrested in Minneapolis raid was regularly checking in with authorities, lawyer says
